channel.title: My batch IDE v2
channel.description:
Well i was making my own little batch file when my sister saw it and was amazed, she wanted to learn, i gave her my IDE (The old one), and overall it helped her. But i was amazed to see how difficult it still was for her. So i updated it a bit to make it more informative: [img]http://img170.imageshack.us/img170/4818/ide2xg2.png[/img]
When you move your mouse over one of the things to add it explains what it does in the information box.
Download - http://www.megaupload.com/?d=UKS5QQAW
Please dont flame me, I know batch isnt a 'real' programing language but it is still fun ;). And very helpful.
Oh and, whoever is approving my posts, sorry. I dont mean to push it :(

item.title: My batch IDE v2
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Very nice IDE. I think I might use it as a reference and see if your way is easier, or if we use the same methods. Hope you understand.

item.title: My batch IDE v2
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I realize that, But most people who need a IDE to script batch dont know much.

And that warning pic, I didnt go to sleep last night, i was finishing it up, then i got frustrated with th optionpane and just made a picture.

I dont really make anything like this anymore. I just did one final update on it.

Read full topic

item.title: My batch IDE v2
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

you do realise that you are missing 99% of batch commands, thus your IDE is totally useless (btw; this is merely an editor, not an ide)

rather than point and click, it is also a zillion times easier just to execute the commands manually

jLabel15.setIcon(new ImageIcon("C:\\Documents and Settings\\Frell\\My Documents\\My Pictures\\warning.PNG"));GG

i am not attacking you, i am just frustrated by the continued posting of useless crap

Read full topic
